snippet: The incoming leader traces his hostility to his belief that U.S. officials helped a badly wounded American flee charges after a hotel room blast.
abstract: Hostility toward United States expressed by Rodrigo Duerte, poised to become president of Philippines, stems from 2002 explosion at Evergreen Hotel in Davao City set off by American Michael Terrence Meiring and subsequent evacuation of Meiring from country by American officials; Duerte has fed speculation that Meiring was involved in covert United States operations in Philippines.
lead_paragraph: The incoming leader traces his hostility to his belief that U.S. officials helped a badly wounded American flee charges after a hotel room blast.

headline.main: Mysterious Blast in Philippines Fuels Rodrigo Duterte’s ‘Hatred’ of U.S.
headline.print_headline: Mysterious Blast in Philippines Shaped Presumptive Leader’s View of U.S.
